description: Borrowed from French défaitisme, coined in 1915 by Russian writer Grigorij Aleksinskij as a translation of Russian пораже́нчество (poražénčestvo), also coined by him as a derivation of порази́ть (porazítʹ, “to strike, defeat”). Surface analysis: defeat +‎ -ism.

examples: Objective assessment is good, but defeatism will reduce our potentials even when the prospects for victory have never been nearer.
